page.title: 14FARMING IN HARNHILL (CONT)
page.content: In addition to the organically grown milling wheat, Mr Henly has also grown Lucerne for the last three years. In the organic context, Lucerne, which is legume, is self-sufficient for nitrogenous plant food supplies and does not require applications of chemical nitrogen.Provided non-chemical supplies of abundant quantities of both phosphate and potassium can be applied to the Lucerne crop it will act as a precursor crop for organically grown Winter Wheat. Additionally, the Lucerne crop does well in dry summers and on the alkaline brash soil at Harnhill, when grass yields can decline dramatically. This practice of using Lucerne as the main forage crop to supply the sheep and pave the way for organically grown wheat is still under test at Harnhill.
